pr_title: [Service Bus] Client validation improvements for cross-language consistency

timeline.message: Adding in error message to explicitly check for a lock token and throw if it's null (catches people accidentally trying to complete peeked messages).

* Throw if the user passes in a null sequence of messages when calling receiveDeferredMessages().
* Return an empty Flux if the user passes an empty list of deferred messages.

* Check the length of the session ID, partitionKey, and message ID to make sure they don't exceed 128 characters (when they do it causes general validation on the service bus side to fail and it's not helpful to pinpoint _why_)
* Add in checks if the user accidentally tries to set different values for session ID and partition key.

* Adding in tests for ServiceBusMessage checks
* (Fixing a few stray comments that said "Act" when they probably meant "Arrange")
* Adding tests to validate changes to getDeferredMessages()

* Fixing problem where I was throwing the exception directly rather than returning it through the Flux.
* Adding in test to make sure we throw a reasonable error when the user tries to complete a peeked message.

timeline.bodyText: Since you are adding validation, I would add a @throws to say what runtime exceptions are thrown.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.message:
* Adding in @throws clauses per Connie's feedback
* Fixing a long line

timeline.bodyText:
We can add this in java doc for all the settlement operation (for ex complete, abandon.. etc ) in the client
@throws UnsupportedOperationException section.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: We might want to put in receiveDeferredMessages API  (which take in Iterable<Long> sequenceNumbers  ) in sync and async client that empty list will complete the flux without sending to service bus .
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: Thinking about this a bit more - are we sure that's something that needs documenting? We're no longer treating it as an error condition so this just seems to fall under normal operating conditions.
replies.author: richardpark-msft

timeline.bodyText: This is done by intellij for you, without you knowing . This should have 4 spaces before  int .  I see few more places like this.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.message: Fixing some more line length issues
Fixing imports that I inadvertantly collapsed in IntelliJ
Undoing some of my inadvertant formatting changes
Updating @throws doc comments to include they can also throw if the message itself was received from peekMessage.
Fixing a missing import from when I tried to revert formatting changes.
Whoops, did not mean to strip out the type there.
cancelScheduledMessages should also no-op with an empty array parameter.
